Description: A head broken from a hollow terracotta figure of Osiris, wearing the 'atef' crown. The back is plain. Two-piece mould. Micaceous light-brown Nile silt, orange-brown at the break. Red paint on feathers and on ears.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: William Talbot Ready, dealer and restorer. Probably Ptolemaic; possibly not ancient. Comparandum. Near: Petrie Museum uc35297.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3023)
